actions.text: Referred to the Subcommittee on Civil Service.

actions.in_committee: House Committee on Post Office and Civil Service
actions.text: Subcommittee Consideration and Mark-up Session Held.

actions.in_committee: House Committee on Post Office and Civil Service
actions.text: Forwarded by Subcommittee to Full Committee.
Mr. Sikorski moved to suspend the rules and pass the bill.
The chair announced that a second on the motion to suspend the rules is not required.
Considered under suspension of the rules.
DEBATE - The House proceeded with forty minutes of debate.
On motion to suspend the rules and pass the bill Agreed to by voice vote.
Motion to reconsider laid on the table Agreed to without objection.
Received in the Senate and read twice and referred to the Committee on Governmental Affairs.

committees.committee: House Post Office and Civil Service
House Post Office and Civil Service

official_title: To amend title 5, United States Code, to clarify provisions relating to the composition of any performance review board making recommendations concerning performance awards for career appointees in the Senior Executive Service.

summary.text: Requires that a majority of performance review board members be career appointees when recommending performance awards for career appointees in the Senior Executive Service unless the Office of Personnel Management determines an insufficient number of career appointees are available to meet such requirement.

titles.title: To amend title 5, United States Code, to clarify provisions relating to the composition of any performance review board making recommendations concerning performance awards for career appointees in the Senior Executive Service.
